content: repeat until the end of the round slip_stitch to top of ch3 cut and tie off -repeat rounds 1-12 on other sleeve cuffs make 2 row1 ch13 single_crochet in in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet across ch1 turn row2 single_crochet in blo across ch1 turn row3-26 repeat row2 until cuff is desired size it should be long enough to wrap around your wrist snuggly be sure leave enough yarn to sew cuff to sleeve -using a whip stitch sew row 1 and 26 together to form cuff and using the remainder of the tail sew to the end of the sleeve extra tip i also used safety pins to pin the cuff to sleeve in place very helpful in trying to keep it even -when attaching cuff to sleeve you can flip the cardigan inside out and sew on that way i think it has a nicer looking seam but totally personal preference -repeat with second cuff 18 collar/border we will be working around the cardigan with an accent color of your choice starting at the back of the neck working down the front of one side along the bottom edge up the front of other side and ending at the beginning stitch at the back of the neck i did 3 total rounds but feel free to add more round1 with rs facing out and back of cardigan facing you attach yarn at the most center stitch on the back of neck ch1 single_crochet evenly down front of the cardigan until you reach the most bottom/last stitch of the front 2 single_crochet in that last stitch on the bottom now turning to work along the bottom edge still with the rs facing you continue to single_crochet evenly across the bottom edge of cardigan going across the back side and ending at the last stitch on that side/most bottom stitch on other side of cardigan insert 2 single_crochet in that corner stitch continue to single_crochet up the front on other side of cardigan ending a joining with beginning single_crochet round2 ch1 single_crochet around join to first single_crochet round3 repeat round2 once more -be sure to secure all your ends i know so many ends but so worth the effort and you re done congrats 19
